docs.lead_paragraph: What does it take to get smokers to give up the habit? For some, not even lung cancer surgery does the trick. In a study of lung cancer patients, researchers found that almost half started smoking again within a year after surgery -- most within two months of the operation.

headline.main: Smoking Again After Lung Cancer Surgery

docs.abstract: Dr Mark S Walker, Washington University School of Medicine psychologist, leads study that finds addictive power of cigarettes is so strong that half of all patients who have had lung cancer surgery will begin smoking again within year after surgery; research is published in journal Cancer Epidemiology Biomarkers and Prevention; drawing (M)
